intro: Cyperus nervulosus, commonly known as narrow-veined flatsedge, is a flowering plant in the sedge family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and a dense cluster of spikelets at the top of its stems. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wet or marshy environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain ecosystems.
